campaign.story:
Classic Branle deck's success inspired us to come up with it's even more limited, Royal Branle edition. Our idea is to create something unique, present cool features, make this deck pop among others.
This deck will include features newer used before.
Royal Branle exclusive edition deck is an add-on to original project. Back of this deck will be printed with exclusive real gold based pigment inks. First ever new debosing technology will be used to produce Velvet tuck box with extreme detailing of debossing pattern. Deck will include white cover "jacket" with gold foil stamped logo. Custom shape and design for numbered seals which could contain owner's name. 
Only very limited amount of decks will be printed (400 decks only) and only 370 decks will be available on Kickstarter. 
We use FREE WORLDWIDE registered airmail delivery to every backer.
Name of the deck was inspired by Branle, 12th-century French chain dance adopted (c. 1450–c. 1650) by European aristocrats, especially in France and in England, where the word branle was anglicized as “brawl.” Aristocrats frequently performed pantomimic branles in which they scolded each other like washerwomen or courted (as in the branle de Poitou, the possible ancestor of the minuet). Certain branles, especially in France, were designated for specific age groups, such as the lively branle de Bourgogne for the youngest dancers.
Branle Playing Cards deck portrays history and culture of XVI-XVII centuries. Each of the suits can be associated with a particular European country. For example, the peaks - Britain, hearts - France, clubs - Spain and diamonds - Eastern Europe (Rzeczpospolita, Transylvania, Hungary). Suits are not linked to these countries directly, but the association is undoubtedly present. It is more like an alternative view to the real European history and culture of that era.
All artwork created by Chesley Trem.
All artistic photography by Iryna Kotiv https://www.facebook.com/iryna.kotiv
Jacks
Queens
Kings
Aces
Back
Extreme detailing for debossing pattern
Royal Branle features
- only 400 decks ever printed. 370 decks available on Kickstarter 
- velvet tuck box with new technology of debossing
- real golden based pigments ink on backs
- gold foil stamped tuck cover "jacket"
- custom shape and design numbered seal with your name on it (maximum 10+10 symbols)
velvet tuck box with new technology of debossing
real golden based pigments ink on backs
gold foil stamped tuck cover "jacket"
custom shape and design numbered seal with your name on it
Check update from Dec 19 for more information
24K Gold Plated Dealer Coin. D=40mm (Check update from Dec 19 for more information)
Engraving pattern (will be filled with golden paint) for 2-deck wooden box (Check update from Dec 19 for more information)
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As it is not our first Kickstarter project, all possible risks were taken highly serious. We have done a lot of research to ensure that this project goes smoothly. Everything - from technical moments and design, to production time and shipping - checked twice. We got valuable experience on our previous projects, so production and shipping costs are precisely calculated and included in the project goal.

Printing is scheduled for January 2016 
Estimated shipping: end of February - March
Delivery via registered airmail.

We guarantee to deliver the best product possible to you on time.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
RARE LIMITED EDITION RE-LAUNCH (only 250 Decks will be produced)
I am happy to share with you the my second deck production by UnTied States appropriately named "THE SWORD" Playing Cards. You read that right, UN-TIED not united, it is an intentional play on words to signify the United States cutting the ties of injustice and bigotry that has made up such a large part of its history.
The message of the UnTied States brand is to be a symbol of acceptance and inclusion of all people no matter what their background may be. The Sword has a dual meaning, the cutting of such ties that bind the country in social injustice and how the pen is mightier than the sword.
My name if Nate of Ember Waves. I have been a musician and graphic designer for over 15 years. This is my second Kickstarter Campaign, I was very pleased by the reaction from the "Capitalists" Playing Cards. My mission is to continue to make 100% custom designed playing cards in small batch orders for collectors and cardists alike.
White & Silver Deck (Unlocks at 4,500)
A Closer Look
Features:
Printed by the MPC
54 Custom Cards (Including A Dual-Reveal Joker)
Each court, Ace and Joker cards will have original illustrations with my own personal take on the standard faces.
The Cards will be printed on MPC's Linen 310 GSM Stock
Fully custom Tuck Box that will stand out on any collectors display.
A Closer Look
"Capitalists" Playing Cards Add-ons
If you missed the Capitalists Playing Card Kickstarter Project this June, you can now add the Capitalists decks to your "THE SWORD" pledge to complete your collection.
*Read Add-On Sheet on how to add to your pledge.
 * Add-On 1 or 2 Decks of The Capitalists to any order:
$10 single deck add-on  OR:
 $19 Dual Deck Add-On
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
I learned so much from my first campaign with "The Capitalists" and now I'm ready to kick it into high gear! All the first time challenges have come and passed and I have learned excellent lessons to streamline the production.
The Cards will be made by the MPCC and have a quick turnaround!
This is the 2nd Deck I have produced of The Untied States Brand and I and my team will be working to ship these cards out as soon as this project is funded and the cards are made.
Shipping Dates may be subject to change, however January is what we have decided would be the timeline this could be done, just in time for the new year!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Visit our site: edgybrothers.com
Visit us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/EdgyBrothers?ref=aymt_homepage_panel
For our latest deck, we drew inspiration from the majesty and elegance of royal houses of European history, creating the Rose Deck with corresponding color scheme and imagery.
We took care to include the elements for which we've become known over our Kickstarter campaigns - vibrant colors and intricate detail, enhanced by gold and silver metallic inks.
 The Rose Deck will have a limited print run of only 1,000 decks through the United States Playing Card Company. Of those, 850 will be made available to Backers during the campaign. 
The Rose Deck
The tuck case features a front gate in the foreground welcoming you to the Rose House, with an Anglo feel informing the lettering.
Rose Deck Back
Rose Deck Fan
The deck back features design elements prevalent in Renaissance architecture and various royal palaces. In the center is the Rose window, with shading used throughout the design to add layers of depth, highlighted by gold accents.
Rose Deck Courts
For the Courts, we've used a painting-style approach, reflecting the popular trend of the aristocracy to immortalize itself in portraiture during the height of European monarchy.
King of Spades, Queen of Hearts
We wanted each Court character's expression to tell a different story, whether it be Intrigue, seduction, or political scheming - all elements found in the parlors and reception rooms at a royal palace.
Queen of Clubs, Jack of Diamonds
Jack of Hearts, Jack of Spades
Rose Deck Pips
The Gilded Deck
 The Gilded Version of the Rose Deck will have a 300 print run, 250 of which will be made available to Backers. It features a gilded-edge deck and a tuck design with a predominant gold theme.
Deck Features
Manufactured by the United States Playing Card Company
Only 1,300 total decks printed (1,000 Rose, 300 Gilded)
Air Cushion Finish
Gold and Silver Metallic Inks
Currently, there are no Add Ons for the campaign. Our pledge tiers cover a variety of options for Backers, so anyone getting in early enough will have the ability to pledge for both Rose and Gilded Decks.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is our fifth campaign (fourth for cards), and we've learned that no matter how smoothly your campaign goes, executing your fulfillment properly is just as important as designing a great deck of cards. We expect some delays since there always are, but we intend to have all pledges fulfilled by March.

And, as always, we will be ever present on the comment boards and in the private message forum. Our Backers from previous campaigns can attest to having questions and concerns answered quickly, and to receiving frequent updates as to the status of the project.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
We wanted to say thanks again to everyone for their support and let you all know about our latest project, Edgy Brothers Presents!
We're creating animated comedy episodes that are a minute or two long (with the little bit of edge that you'd expect from us), and we've found the best platform for them is on Patreon.com, where we can raise money for each individual episode instead for a whole season at once. Here's a sample:

updates.update_userinfo: Remaining Rose and Gilded Decks now available for purchase!
updates.update_content:
We've had some enquiries as to when we'd be putting the remaining Rose and Gilded Decks available for sale, now that all decks have been delivered. As of now, they are available for purchase on our site, edgybrothers.com. Check them out!
http://edgybrothers.com/Edgy_Brothers/Royal_House_Decks.html
We estimate a little over a hundred decks are left, and we're keeping the rest for insurance purposes for shipping and our own private (and very small) collection. So, jump on these now, because once they're gone, they're gone. Take care!

We hope you're all enjoying your decks, and we are exploring ways to make the remaining few dozen Gilded Decks available from our inventory in the near future. We'll let you know when we decide.
In the meantime, we have just launched a project that we started work on separately over nine months ago, and didn't want to launch until we knew the Royal House project was completely fulfilled. It's an RPG (Role Playing Game) and it's something that is near and dear to our hearts. For all you Gamers out there, have a look at Soldier of Ages, the RPG!

Just wanted to let everyone know that the packages have all been shipped out. Check your email to make sure you get tracking info and that should allow you to monitor your rewards as they make their way to you.
And, as always, we love it when you send us pics when your decks arrive. Let us know!
Finally, finally, finally! Behold the Gilded Decks...

We have gotten word from USPCC that they have finally received the gilded decks and need a few days to prepare them to send to us, but at least we're looking at receiving them (hopefully) in the next two weeks. At that point we will immediately ship them out to all of you who've pledged for them. Thanks again for your unbelievable patience. 
In the meantime, some of you who've followed and supported us for the past couple of years may be pleasantly surprised to hear that a deck that David, our artist, designed on his own last year (but unfortunately didn't get funded) has been purchased and is now live  with a new campaign. Check out the Gorilla Deck, by Albino Dragon!

We finally have some word on the gilded decks, and according to USPCC, they are set to receive the decks by June 9th. After that, it takes them less than a week to finish them and have them ready to ship to us. So, if we add a week to that, i think we're looking at being able to ship the gilded pledge rewards (and the rose decks that go with them) in about two weeks, hopefully. With any luck, everyone, including international backers, will receive their rewards by the end of the month or the first week of July. 
Again, thank you all for your patience and understanding. We hate delivering late on rewards, but there's not much we can do when fulfillment is taken out of our hands. Rest assured, once those decks arrive, we're going to get them out with all speed.

Unfortunately, we received an email from the USPCC on Friday notifying us that the gilding process is taking longer than anticipated and will be delayed by approximately one month. They apologized immediately as they're aware that this puts us way behind our schedule, and we asked that they do whatever is necessary to speed up the process.
Alas, this is one of the common risks and challenges in the card game, and of the various decks we've had funded and fulfilled, we've never had one arrive without delay. We are truly sorry for this news, but we can't do much about it except ask USPCC to light a fire under themselves to get it done sooner. We'll let you know if we hear about a schedule change.
Feast your eyes...

Finally! As we warned, there are always delays it seems when it comes to decks, and this campaign is no different. But USPCC has informed us that the Rose Decks are shipping from their warehouse and should be arriving in about a week or less to our fulfillment address in Austin. Once there, they should be processed and sent out to Backers within a few days at most. With any luck, most of you who ordered only Rose Decks will have them by the end of the month, keeping us juuust on schedule.
As for the Gilded Decks, we've been notified that they take an extra four weeks to make since USPCC outsources the work (and is not planning on offering the service after this, so we got in just in time), so for anyone who ordered both Rose and Gilded Decks, we'll keep you up to date on their progress. But we hope they'll be ready in the next couple of weeks or so since they sent them off to be gilded some time ago.

Check out the black deck, some high resolution card images, and the part of the coloring book at the bottom of the page!
My design partners at Deveo Media and I have created a project showcasing Chinese culture. We hope you enjoy seeing it as much as we enjoyed making it!
“Middle Kingdom” was used to refer to civilizations around the Yellow River Valley before the empires leading to modern-day China began to form. The two characters in the ideogram for China, 中国, are part of those for Middle Kingdom, 中央王国, so the reference has stood the test of time. The court cards use exquisitely detailed line art of Chinese deities and people, while the card back is a great freehand drawing with interpretations of Chinese lattice borders and, of course, a dragon.
 China's vast history provides a rich palette of subjects for court cards.
King of Hearts: Pangu, the first living being and creator of the Earth from chaos
King of Diamonds: Caishen, the main Chinese deity of prosperity
King of Clubs: Huangdi, the Yellow Emperor, creator of the centralized state
King of Spades: Tai Di, the "Primordial Divinity" or "Utmost God"
Queen of Hearts: He Xiangu, an immortal renowned for her selfless caring for others
Queen of Diamonds: Lan Caihe, an immortal portrayed sometimes as a man dressed as a woman and other times as a woman, Lan Caihe was said to have ridden to heaven on the back of a magical swan while in a drunken stupor
Queen of Clubs: Xi Wangmu, Queen Mother of the West. She held court and allowed deities to meet in her perfect palace
Queen of Spades: Nuwa, humanity's creator along with her twin brother, Fuxi
Jack of Hearts: Fuxi, humanity's creator along with his twin sister, Nuwa
Jack of Diamonds: Luxing, a deity who made people happy through promotions and salary increases
Jack of Clubs: Yu Shi, the rain deity
Jack of Spades: Zhan Yinbao, an Army officer
Fantastic creatures play a large role in Chinese mythology, and we wanted to honor those representing our suits:
Phoenix (Hearts)- Sun, warmth, and love
Kui (Clubs)- A one-legged Ox that would warn of coming storms. The Yellow Emporer (the King of Spades) used Kui's skin for a drum that could be heard hundreds of miles away
Pixiu (Diamonds)- Brings in good luck and wealth and drives away evil
Dragon (Spades)- The most powerful creature
 The card back combines a dragon with another famous Chinese element, the Yin-Yang symbol. This symbol represents positive and negative, order and chaos, male and female.
 Combining elements of Chinese architecture, latticework, and dragon art, the tuck box is the perfect complement to the cards.
$12,000- Funded!
$15,000- White deck custom seal

Signature Card- $7

The figurines will have U.S. fulfillment costs included. For Canada/Mexico, add $10 for any quantity. For the Rest of the World, add $20 for any quantity.

campaign.story:
Introduction
Impressions Foil Femme Playing Cards (The Femme Deck) are designed and manufactured by MakePlayingCards.com (MPC®), a renowned custom playing cards printing and manufacturing company. This is our fourth Kickstarter project, our previous projects has generated huge interest in the gaming industry. We are now back with another exciting deck of playing cards inspired by femininity, but more importantly, using the latest in printing and manufacturing technology.
Impressions Foil Femme by MPC
MPC Ace of Spades with foil back
The Femme Deck
Following on the huge success of our previous projects where we used high gloss, touch and feel printing technology to playing cards, which has had such widespread appeal and have definitely grown way above our expectations, we have been working altogether again on creating another card deck concept.
While there are many playing card designs out there, there seemed to be not that many decks in the industry using softer tones such as pastel colors which is a surprise. The Femme deck is a concept deck inspired by beauty, femininity, love and romance. We finalized on pink and mint colors which were chosen carefully from research of reports of popular colors which could represent this concept.  The outcome of using the combination of these colors with raised high gloss embossing with metallic printing technology are absolutely beautiful and we're proud to share it with everyone. We introduce to you, the all new Impressions Foil Femme Playing Cards.
The Impressions Foil Femme decks are pretty much amazing and definitely playing cards that you'll not have seen before with this kind of beauty. With an added “touch and feel” dimension to a well-established product, which we introduced to the gaming industry, feeling the touch of the cards is an exciting experience in itself.
Close-up of card back
Who's it for?
These playing cards are for everyone. Despite its femininity themed colors, they will appeal to all as there's no denying the colors coupled with this technology is a great match.
Mint deck
Pink deck
The astoundingly shiny foil back playing cards with raised UV printing is the first of its kind in the playing cards industry. What's more, they can very much be played with like a normal CMYK printed deck and with superb performance. We have had countless number of testing of prototypes. Keeping these cards true as a deck of cards, we are using professional playing cards grade air pocketed paper card stock (linen) with a black core center layer.
Developing this deck is possible only through our skilled workforce and dedication to do what others have not done before. The knowledge that our mother company QP Group has acquired in its 33 years history and its ongoing investments in the latest technology, manufacturing methods and people have allowed us to create this exceptionally special Impressions Foil range.
Technology
The technology used behind our Impressions Foil Femme Playing Cards is a mix of traditional manufacturing methods plus state of the art secondary process industrial machinery. In short, we apply embossed gloss UV using pinpoint accuracy on state of the art machinery onto a layer of thin foil on the complex card back design which produces the outstandingly attractive and shiny metallic card back look.
The high gloss is very different to traditional spot UV as this revolutionary technology can produce a raise of up 250 microns in polymer height (which is Braille). We can also control the density of polymer applied, which is a ground breaking technology in printed materials.
Our signature high gloss UV is widely acclaimed due to its glossiness and characteristics to enable players to touch and feel the cards. Reaching 99GU gloss, which is the highest possible on printed material, giving the foil layer an extra shine, further strengthening the metallic shine experience.
Comparison with normal printed cards
The Impressions Foil Femme Playing Cards are produced on 310gsm linen professional grade paper card stock. This is one of the top card stock that MPC offers, with black core center layer and equipped with an air pocketed surface creating a fantastically smooth handling experience.
Handling
We believe that playing cards is definitely an art, but at the same time, we don’t want to just create an art piece. We at MPC make sure that all cards that we produce are absolutely playable and would offer an exceptional handling experience for those of us who need it such as magicians and cardistry enthusiasts. You can see how they perform in the project video.
One handed fan
Design
On releasing playing cards under our MPC brand, we also developed our own unique playing card design to go with it. Our signature back consists of a symmetrical illustration of a fully grown tree.
MPC tree back
We need trees to make paper and as a responsible paper product manufacturer and print company, QP devotes endless resources to help create a better environment by enforcing recycling efforts and expanding usage of recycled materials on mass productions. We have chosen a tree design to remind ourselves of our roots and values. The card face of these Impressions Foil cards adopts a standard design for practicality. All artwork were fully redrawn to create this design unique to MPC.
The Femme decks comes in colors pink and mint tree back, making it the perfect addition to your collection and more importantly, can become your everyday deck of cards for entertainment and performance.
Stretch goal
$15K - Once we reach this funding goal, we will upgrade our regular seals on each tuck box to the special gold signed MPC seal.
We're working on more surprises.
Metallic Tuck box
The tuck box contains a layer of thin foil and the revolutionary high gloss UV technology to apply different levels of polymer (very glossy raised ink) to certain parts of the artwork to form a touch and feel effect.
Foiled tuck boxes
Uncut sheets
We have the Pink and Mint foil back uncut sheets available through our ULTIMATE COLLECTORS pledge or you can buy them individually for $30 each as an add-on.
Gifts
As always we’re hoping to be able to include a gift for all our backers. This would depend on the amount of funding raised, and it would most likely come in a form of an item or coupon to use at MakePlayingCards.com.
Pledges Breakdown
Pledge list
Add-ons
Add-ons list
More About Us
MPC is owned and operated by QP Group which was established in 1982. QP is now the major manufacturer for many household board and card games. Our products go under strict inspection from our lab and from globally recognized organizations. With over 30 years of experience in premium paper-based item manufacturing and print production, QP has proven to deliver professional products to clients around the world.
MPC was launched in 2012 and within a 3 year time frame we’ve grown at an unbelievable pace and have become one of the leading choices for manufacturing professional quality custom playing cards. Not only do we source the best materials, MPC also offers different kinds of printing technologies for you to create outstanding and very unique custom designs. Visit us at MakePlayingCards.com for more details on what we do.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
As we are a playing cards printer and manufacturer, we can eliminate many issues that others may run into with third party manufacturers. As many of you may know, manufacturing could be interrupted by many reasons (system breakdowns, maintenance, technical issues, color deviations etc) which you have minimal control over. But since Impressions Foil are produced in-house, we will aim our resources for this project when the time comes for production.

Quality control is another challenge we will face but be rest assured, we have it under control and will have your product shipped to you at the quickest time possible. We learned a lot from our previous projects and the last one when very smooth.

The fulfillment of these rewards will be carried out through our own MPC Fulfillment Center which uses a highly efficient logistics network with tracking or recorded delivery which is used every day for MakePlayingCards.com orders. We also use strengthened packaging with plenty of padding to help prevent damages from happening during transit.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Dear Backers
British racing green themed deck
This one is for the Brits among us. The all new Impressions Racing Ed. playing cards which takes on a British racing green theme. Without further ado, here are some photos of this amazing new deck to admire.
Support us here: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/makeplayingcards/impressions-cardinal-ed-playing-cards

Dear Backers
New Impressions deck
It's been a while since we saw the release of the last Impressions playing cards with MPC's revolutionary high gloss embossing. After months of hard work, we have finally released the Impressions Cardinal Ed. playing cards now on Kickstarter. So without further ado, I present to you a couple of photos of this new amazing deck.

Dear Backers
All shipped
This is just an update to all our backers to say that all rewards have been shipped as of 1 February 2016. Depending where you are, it will take different lengths of time to reach you but it will get to you.

Dear Backers
We're just about ready...
With this update, we come with great news. We are indeed in our final step of our production process and we'll be starting the shipping of these beautiful MPC® Impressions Foil playing cards, pink and mint version within the next 2 weeks from our own in-house Fulfillment Center. The shipping will be done in no particular order and should hopefully reach you within the month of February 2016 as planned. Here's a photo I took for your viewing pleasure.

Dear Backers
Happy New Year
Hope you all had a great festive time. We at MPC have not really been on holiday but rather still working away on orders for custom playing cards on our site http://www.makeplayingcards.com, December being the busiest month for us.

Dear Backers
Greetings
Hoping you all had a great Christmas. Now the New Year celebrations to look forward to!
Please remember...

Dear Backers
Project end
Thank you all for supporting us on the Impressions Foil Femme Playing Cards project where we used unconventional colors coupled with high gloss and foil layered back to produce a very attractive deck of cards that you will all be proud owners of very soon. What's more, they handle very well too. If you haven't already yet, see the link below to our Youtube videos to check out how these decks handle.

Dear Backers
1 week in
Thank you to all of you for backing us on our Impressions Foil Femme playing cards project with revolutionary foil and high gloss printing on card back. We've just passed our 1 week mark and during this time, we've been trying to take more photos to do justice to these amazing cards which has been very difficult to do as the camera takes out the glare of the cards. But check out some of the photos below which we have managed to take.

campaign.story:
"Maike and me met at the University and worked together on some illustration and infographic projects, some free and some for clients. One day I had the idea to create our very own playing cards deck, and we started to scribble and sketch funny characters, which eventually led into the whole „Geistreiz“ deck. Maike and I made the concepts and sketches together and I brought them to life digitally"
                                                                              - Stefan Grosse Halbuer
 http://www.maxplayingcards.com/en/2015/11/20/gestreiz-playing-cards-a-modern-funny-and-original-deck-of-cards12188/
The idea for this deck is unique characters with a modern touch, unique and interesting-looking.
The main intention was to create a style of cards, never seen before. Each of the court cards, especially the ace cards, should contain at least one little nice detail: like King with tv-remote and a beer cup, or a glamorously looking Queen with long cigarette, or a glass of wine :)
All illustrations are completely custom hand-drawn with the help of unique Stippling technique that uses small dots to create degrees of solidity, shading and shadows.
Stippling technique that uses small dots to create degrees of solidity, shading and shadows.
 A lot of people had been asking for more classic-looking pips and some more minor changes in design for better playability. So, we came up with additional variation of the deck - Geistreiz Classic. It features different color scheme, 2-way backs, standard pips, removed center numbers on numbered cards, and rearranged layout. Here is the comparison of key differences:
Printed and Fulfilled by the NPCC
Never printed again
Custom Courts, Aces, Jokers, Pips Layout, Backside and Tuck box  
Casino Classic Black Core Card stock with Linen Finish
Premium Card Stock Box
UltraSleek Card coating

campaign.story:
Thank you to each & every backer for a great campaign.
  Concept by: Steven Fields
Design & Art by: Steven Fields & Greg "Jazzy Bear" Brown  
Released & Distributed by: TwoGeeksGaming
Printing by: MPC
100% custom face cards, aces, pips, jokers, and coloring
All 54 cards have their own individual artwork
Each deck has 2 distinct art styles, Figures & Elements
Custom Tuck Box
310 GSM (Black Core) card stock with Linen Finish
Limited production run
The first deck in a continuing series of themed minimalist playing cards
What exactly are the SMArt Series Playing Cards? 
This will be an ongoing series of "Themed" poker playing card decks that will always have that minimalist art style. We plan on releasing several decks (or series) a year and each of these decks will have a different theme. We have always loved that look of the Minimalist art style and in what you can convey with just simple lines, blacks & whites and solid bold coloring. It is a style that is very unique and really stands out.
Our face cards are the 10's, Jacks, Queens, Kings, Aces, and Jokers. These have what we refer to as "Figure Art".
Our pip cards are the 2-9 and have what we refer to as "Element Art".
We spent a lot of time and went through several versions when developing the card back. This ultimately was the one we decided to use. It is a completely mirrored back and works on several visual levels.
Top - Standard Deck / Bottom - Miniverse Deck
One of our all time favorite tuck boxes is the Heretic set by Stockholm 17. It is a thing of beauty in its nearly all black design. Right from the start, we knew we wanted to keep that minimalist look throughout everything and it made sense to make our tuck box very stark. Bits of color, mostly blacks and greys, and with just enough information on it so you knew what deck you had in your hands.
Standard Tuck Box
Prices include S&H costs. If you have any questions or special requests, please Private Message or Email us.
STANDARD DECK ($15 US / $18 World)
54 card custom poker style playing cards. Each card has their own individual artwork in two distinct art styles, Figures & Elements. 310 GSM (Black Core) card stock with Linen Finish. Custom tuck box.
Mighty Heroic Minis - Standard Deck
New - MINIVERSE DECK ($30 US/ $33 World)
This is an all new limited production companion deck to our standard one above. It is basically the equivalent to a red poker deck... while the standard deck would be considered a black poker deck.
New Features - Back of the cards are now red (of course). All the King cards have different & new figures not seen in the standard deck. The background behind the main art for the front of the cards is reversed. Alternative versions of the Joker cards. Alternative red colored tuck box.
Miniverse Deck
UNCUT SHEET ($40 US / World - Email for Quote)
This is a 310 GSM Linen Finish Uncut Sheet. It has all 54 playing cards (includes the Jokers) and the card back design as well. This truly does look awesome on the wall. 
MIGHTY HEROIC MINIS T-SHIRT ($30 US / $40 World)
We have two styles and several options for you to choose from. So you can get that perfect T-Shirt for yourself or someone else:
 CUSTOMIZABLE T-SHIRT ($40 US / $50 World)
We wanted the backers to be involved in having fun with us. So, we are letting you do something very cool with "Make-Your-Own" Customized T-Shirt. You can choose from 1 to 8 pieces of our artwork that are in this campaign and we will take that art and design your very own one-of-a-kind t-shirt. 
Style C... & some examples
3D PICTURE CARDS - 2 Pieces ($12 US / $14 World)  
You will receive two 4x6 3D Picture Cards that actual transform from one image to another when you look at them. This process is also known as Lenticular printing.  
BOOKMARK SET - 5 Pieces ($7 US / $9 World)  
A five piece set of 2x6 double sided & reversible Bookmarks... which includes all 20 face card Figures represented on the playing cards.
MOUSEPAD ($10 US / $14 World) 
Premium 7x8 Fabric Mousepad that is made from durable, high-density black foam, which stands up to everyday wear and tear.Thickness 3/16 inch. 
(Includes some alternative figures not seen on the playing cards)
MAGNET SET - 4 Pieces ($9 US / $11 World)
A four piece set of 2.5x3.5 UV Coated Vinyl Magnets.
(Includes 2 new figures not seen on the standard deck)
ART OF MIGHTY HEROIC MINIS - COLLECTORS EDITION BOOKS 
Hardcover Edition ($22 US / $25 World)
Digital PDF Edition ($6 US / $6 World)
A beautiful 6x8 premium 20 page collectors book. This will showcase all the art that made it into the game, as well as, some alternate costume versions and other art that didn't make it onto the final cards. If you want to have it all... then this is the thing for you. Comes in either a Hardcover bound edition or a digital PDF edition.
(*BONUS - Hardcover also includes the Digital PDF Book version as well)

So what has changed from the previous campaign?
1. MPC will now handle all the card production. This way it makes things a bit more manageable for us.
2. Much lower funding goal of only $2100.00 instead of the original $8000.00. This one should easily be obtainable.
3. Deck prices are a little bit cheaper... for the most part. We've tried to pass those savings onto our backers. Every little bit helps nowadays.
4. We've put up all new and really interesting Add-On's for you to get. Some we have never seen offered before in a campaign, Please check those out above.
5. We had to remove some of the previous characters. BUT, there are new ones in their place that are just awesome. Check them all out.
6. All the artwork has been improved and enhanced. The background have a more 3D look and feel to it and all the figures have a slight shadow behind them that makes them seem like they are jumping off the card. Really cool looking stuff.
7. Our backers had suggested easier to read cards. Well... you asked for it and you got it. First, we made the numbers/pips and suits much larger. Next, we removed the right handed side numbers/pips in favor of a more streamlined look, as well as, going back to the industry standard of Red/Black coloring on all the cards.
I noticed that Mighty Heroic Minis states it is Series 1.1. What does this mean?
It just simply means that this is Series 1 Deck 1. 
So... series 1 will always be your Mighty Heroic Minis. In the future, if we do a second deck of all new characters, it would be Mighty Heroic Minis – Series 1.2 or Series 1 Deck 2. That way you always know what specific deck you have in your hands.
I see there is a tier that has a “Limited Edition” Mighty Heroic Minis LE deck. What is that?
It is truly a unique deck of cards. It uses MPC’s new High Gloss technique for printing. So far there have been about 5 or so decks on the market that use it. But, when you see them, you will be blown away. I was stunned on how beautiful and different they are than anything else out there. Check out this video to see what we are talking about.
PLAY

How are the funds going to be used?
Two Geeks Gaming is a small design company specializing in Card Games, Tabletop Games and Custom Artwork. We have invested thousands of dollars into getting the company started and designing this one deck. We also have three more decks planned for release in the upcoming 2016 year. 
So the bottom line is this... if there are any profits made from this campaign, it will go right back into development for our next deck and future projects.
 Twogeeksgaming01@gmail.com
Read about us here
Read about us here
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The artwork, design, planning, and budgeting has already been completed. MPC has already given us the preliminary thumbs up for moving onto production. We just need to give them the very last designs and of course the funds for manufacturing.

The only risk now is Natural disasters or acts of God... or possibly an unexpected issue with our manufacturer. Which I honestly don't see happening, as we are only using a very reputable company in the card industry. They have even run their own successful Kickstarter campaigns. We also padded in an extra few weeks just to make sure we would meet our deadline.

I will post regular updates, so you can keep track of every stage of Mighty Heroic Minis and see it come to life.

Once again, thanks for all the support Kickstarter!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

Yesterday we re-launched our Overlords deck as SKY LORDS - Premium Playing Cards with an all new lower pricing.  
It took us a bit longer than expected to launch it, but because of this, we were able to negotiate better prices for both USA and International to such awesome levels. So now it has much lower prices for the deck & shipping as well. Please check it out and support our new deck.
LINK: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/273403520/sky-lords-premium-playing-cards?ref=category

updates.update_userinfo: We have launched our newest campaign... OVERLORDS
updates.update_content:
Overlords - Classic style Playing Cards
Today we launched the campaign for our newest deck of Playing Cards. Overlords is a 56 card, classic style poker deck with a truly unique Sci Fi twist. The deck was inspired by movies like... Dune, Highlander, and even Romeo & Juliet. We hope you will take a look at it and support us again. This is our most ambitious deck yet and we are very proud of it. The campaign is also EU Friendly, Australia/Canada/USA Friendly as well. So please pledge and tell all your friends and family.

updates.update_userinfo: Our Next Campaign... Overlords Playing Cards
updates.update_content: We will be launching our next Kickstarter campaign within the next few weeks. It is a Classic looking (style) poker deck with an interesting Sci Fi twist. This is probably our most mainstream playing card deck that we have done to date. Something that a lot of fans and followers have been asking for. We call it OVERLORDS... and here is a sneak peek at the back of the cards. We hope to see you all there and continue to receive love and support.

Something new...
Yesterday we launched our newest campaign called Diabolique Engines. It is a beautiful set of customized poker playing cards with a theme of gears, pulleys, clockworks, and is steampunk inspired. Not only do we have the decks for you, but there are a lot of very cool add-ons to get as well... like a Customized Gold Coin, Uncut Sheets, and Carat Card Cases to protect your new decks.

As of today, we have shipped every and all backers rewards. T-Shirts came in this week and I rushed to package them up and get them out as quickly as possible.
So we are now 100% shipped and that pretty much finishes up this campaign. 
I would still love to hear from all you backers on your reviews of the decks. So please post them in the main comments section if you could.

Just a small update. For those backers who ordered the Digital Collector's Book for The Art Of Mighty Heroic Minis... that link to download it was sent out to you a few days ago on Monday. Please check your inbox to make sure you got it.
If there is anyone else who now wants it but didn't get it initially, we will make it available this week as a special deal for just $5. Just PM me for details.
That's it for now,

Just a quick update for everyone.
As of today, we have shipped out 90% of all our backers rewards. This is for both domestic and international shipments. 
The remaining 10% that is still currently pending to go out are for those backers that are receiving decks & other items as well. So anyone that's getting T-Shirts, Books, Mouse Pads or anything else... those rewards are still waiting on that stuff to arrive from the manufacturer. It shouldn't be too much longer though. You will have your items before our end of March deadline.

updates.update_userinfo: The decks are in and shipping to begin soon
updates.update_content:
Down the home stretch!
So the big news that I was holding off to talk about until today is that we have received all of the decks from MPC. This is great news as it is nearly 2 months earlier than we had quoted during the campaign.
All three decks turned out great. Colors are nice and vibrant and everything is very readable... just perfect. I think my own personal favorite is the Special Edition deck with the high gloss finish. It gives the cards an almost 3D effect. Really cool and something you just don't see everyday.

Everyone here at 2GG hopes that you have a very Merry Christmas and a Happy New Year. Thank you for being a part of Mighty Heroic Minis. Great things are to come in 2016.
Now... onto some good news. 
We got back the final Pre-Production deck samples from MPC and they look spectacular. Everything we hoped they could be and more. No other changes need to be made.

Where we currently stand...
So we finished all the files for the 3 decks and sent them over to MPC for final art/coloring approval. Once they give us the thumbs up, then will begin to make all your decks. Right now we are 100% on schedule for everything. That is awesome news and makes us very happy. 
T-Shirts pledged or won...

campaign.story:
details in the update #10, click on this image
No.17  "Le Chat Rouge" is a custom designed deck of poker size playing cards.  "Le Chat Rouge" (red cat in French)  is the name i chose for the third and final version of the "No.17" deck. I started the design over 1 year ago, and I have continuously improved on since I wanted to make an elegant and intriguing version.
BEFORE-AFTER, SPOT THE DIFFERENCES :)
In this case the face of the Queen Of Spades has been modified
About the production: The deck will be printed by Expert Playing Card Company (EPCC) with classic finish. The goal for this deck is a little high because the deck is full of features and the production costs are very high (twice a normal deck). I need to produce at least 2000 units to keep the production costs affordable.
About me: Requiem Team is just me, one-man-band. My name is Lorenzo, I live and work in Stockholm, Sweden. Designing and illustrating playing cards is my passion and this is my 4th Kickstarter campaign; the previous three have been funded and fulfilled, just take a look at Requiem, Heretic and No17. I hope you like No.17 Le Chat Rouge and that you want to support it by backing and sharing. Thank you for being here! :)
In every campaign I run, I give gifts to the backers ;) but there are a few rules about those.
First of all, the gifts are not add-ons. Only the copper coin and the uncut tuck-box sheet, and the normal decks can be added on top of your pledge.
The gifts are automatically assigned during the shipping process. If the guys at the fulfillment center pack one deck, they will put the gift for one deck. If they pack 2 decks, they will put the gifts for 2 decks, etc etc.
gifts overview
Here is how it works:
If you have one deck, you get one sticker. 
If you have 2 or 3 decks, you get one sticker and one button pin. 
If you have 4 decks, you get one sticker, one button, and one magnet with bottle opener. 
If you have 6 decks, you get one sticker, one button, one magnet with bottle opener, and one half-brick box for your 6 decks. 
If you have 12 decks (or brick), you get one sticker, one button, one magnet with bottle opener, 2 half-brick boxes for your decks, and one copper coin. 
If you are in the 17er reward, you get all.
All the court cards (J,Q,K) are illustrated and the 4 aces are big and ornate. The pips (2 to 10) are improved, and the jokers are "jester-cats". All the cards have an elegant black border. It is easy to play with, readability is very good, and the cards are made with casino quality paper and finishing.
 The back is full-bleed  with red foiled accents.
photoshop rendering
Note: all the graphics are ready and final. Small tweaks and improvements might be made during or after the campaign.
For this deck I decided to make a tuck-box without ink, it will be foiled in black and red, embossed, on black paper. More will be unveiled during the campaign, such as the back side and other details.
back of the tuck, with cutout in the middle, showing the backs of the cards (stretch goal)
Red Label Limited Edition Deck
This deck is NOT AN ADD-ON. You can get it ONLY IF you are in the limited reward (now sold out), or in the reward called "The 17er".
I will produce approx. 110-120 units, it depends by the count at the end of the campaign. It is an exquisite piece for collectors and playing cards lovers.
Here the specs:
cards: same as the normal deck 
tuck-box: same die-cut, but completely black. no foil and no embossing 
Laser-cut “sleeve” on red metallic paper, that looks like a label. Actually I´d call it “jacket”, since it is open on the back (see update #3)
golden foil under the front
signature 
numbered 
shipped from the US with tracking number 
awesome Carat case included (transparent acrylic case, lid with magnets) 
shipping included. 
one per backer 
assembled in Stockholm
Red Label Prototype in its Carat Case
Stretch goals and Add-ons will be unlocked and unveiled during the campaign. I will send updates to keep you posted about these question marks.
It is important that you take a quick look at the updates, and see what's new, and how the deck will improve.
ADD-ON: Copper Coin for 101 SEK
This is a 1.5 inch antique copper coin, with epoxy on both sides with reed edge. 
The price for the coin is 101 SEK (approx. $11.8)
If you want one, just add 101 SEK  to your pledge. If you want 2 coins you add 202 SEK, if three coins 303 SEK, etc etc. The coin does not affect your shipping cost.
photoshop rendering
ADD-ON: Uncut Tuck-box Sheet for 203 SEK
This is a flat tuck-box without cuts and score lines. There will be the 2 foils and the embossing.
The price for this one is 203 SEK (approx. $24.5 USD, €21.5, £16 GBP) shipping included anywhere in the world. It will look more or less like the picture, here the details:
dimensions: I estimate 13x29.7cm / 5.1x11.8in, but they might be slightly different. 
shipping cost included shipped from Stockholm 
with signature 
numbered 
photoshop rendering
What is an ADD-ON ?
There are items called "add-on". It simply means that you can add them to your pledge. The add-on is not a reward tier. All you have to do some simple math, push the blue button called "Manage", and modify the total amount. Scroll up and find the button next to the cover image.
Here a couple of examples to make things clear.
Example for US backers: You are in the 1 deck reward, therefore you pledged for 130 SEK. You want to ADD the uncut tuckbox sheet (203 SEK). Just do 130+203 = 333 SEK
Example for international backers: You are in the 1 deck reward, therefore you pledged for 170 SEK. You want to ADD the uncut tuckbox sheet (203 SEK). Just do 170+203 = 373 SEK
Just mail me if you need help :)
Custom Box for 6 decks, included!
This box is FOR FREE for backers with 6 decks or multiples of 6. This is a self-assembling sturdy box, with magnets, and it will wrapped in protective plastic (with 6 decks inside of course). On the top lid: custom red-foiled graphics as shown in the pictures (photoshop rendering on the real box).
Since I am based in Stockholm, the campaign is in Swedish Crowns (Kr SEK). The conversion rate to USD  (Euro and British Pounds) in this list is updated every day of the final days. There are fluctuations all the time, about ±1.5%. but you can keep track of them here 
currency conversion rate updated on November 7th
You can follow me and stay up to date on several social media platforms. There you can see my previous works, what is going on behind the scenes, my future projects, and participate to my giveaway contests. 
FACEBOOK: www.facebook.com/stockholm17
INSTAGRAM: @Stockholm17  and www.instagram.com/stockholm17
TWITTER: @Stockholm_17
WEBSITE: www.stockholm17.com
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
The deck will be printed by EPCC (Expert Playing Card Co. NYC NY1001).

The estimated delivery date is just that, an estimate. it depends on the factory and their workload. I will send the final files at the conclusion of the campaign, but I cannot speed up the production. There is a possibility of earlier delivery, but it all depends on how quickly EPCC completes the production, once I approve all the printing proofs.

Printing a deck of playing cards is a standard procedure, but errors may occur, you never know, the devil is in the details. But this is my fourth project and I do not foresee any issues. I'll keep my eyes open and follow every single step of the project to make it real, as I did for Requiem Playing Cards, Heretic Playing Cards, and No.17.

Be aware that the colors on the screen will not perfectly match with the colors on printed paper. Graphics may improve or change slightly in the final printed version.

THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Dear felines,
Since you liked black tuckboxes with hotfoil and embossing, I was thinking of showing you the latest deck designed by me for the swesidh magician Caroline Ravn.
I am not going to write all the details, those are on the Ravn Sol and Mani kickstarter page, butI just wanted to let you know that the project is 235% funded and we decided to offer a deal that is out of this world: decks for free.
The 3rd variant - in black, called Eclipse - is for free for each custom case in your pledge.

Hello fellow felines! 
I am very glad to let you know that  The House of the Rising Spade Playing Cards is 293%+ funded, with 1040+ residents, raising approx $85,000+ USD, and less than 30 hours remaining.
All released and all unlocked. Holy cat!

Hello everybody!
I just wanted to let you know that my new deck has been launched on kickstarter yesterday. Many of you - i know - are already onboard, but an extra reminder does not hurt. :)
79% funded and 29 days to go.
2 decks (Gemini Terra and Ignis) plus one as stretch goal (Gemini Noctis, with foil on the back, as "Le Chat Rouge").

Hello 17ers!
Almost all the packages arrived. Europe is suffering some delay because the customs are very slow to clear the packages. Some country is fast (UK), others are way too slow (Italy, as always).
Meanwhile I manage to put together an online shop with a few interesting items. Since I have a small leftover, I decided to do a summer sale. FREE SHIPPING WORLDWIDE!

updates.update_content:
Hello 17ers!
Finally all the packages have been shipped out. The group of 160+ backers waiting for their reward has gotten an email with the tracking number.
This group was waiting for the new half-brick boxes and/or the Red Label to arrive at the fulfillment center in Texas.

Hello 17ers,
it looks that all the problems have been solved :)
Finally the Red Labels arrived at the fulfillment center with an unexpected delay even if I shipped them with DHL. Now the guys at Gamblers Warehouse have everything and they are ready to put the Red Labels in their Carat Case and ship them out with the rest of the pending rewards. 160 backers are waiting for their rewards.

good news! Tomorrow the fulfillment center should receive the new 6-deck-boxes and finally ship the packages on hold.
The Red Labels are also on route to the fulfillment center. It might take a few more days, different vector, but as soon as they arrive they will put in the carat case and shipped to you with the rest of the rewards.

campaign.story:
Element Playing Cards is a project created and designed by Alessio Lombardi. He's studying Design at Politecnico di Milano and his passion for graphic design and photography led him to create this new design for Poker cards. To help him is Andrea Lombardi, Chief Information Officer, CEO and ADV Manager of the project.
The cards are carefully printed by Makeplayingcards.com (MPC) with professional finish! This High Quality deck will be perfectly usable by everyone: from casinos to magicians.
Element Decks are printed in a High Quality resolution and have a professional casinò paper finish. Element is perfect for everyone, both for an expert or a collector.
310gsm - Linen cardstock
MINIMALIST DESIGN: 100% Illustrated courts, aces and jokers! 
NEW WAY TO SEE CARDS: 100% custom suits!
HQ PAPER: 310gsm with a black core layer centre to block light shining through
RESISTANT: cards have linen finish with air pockets making them more durable.
MYSTERIOUS: each deck is based on the legend of the four elements!
The deck that we have chose to start the campaign is the Element Blue Deck but with your help we hope to make you available the Element Red Deck. If you're ready for an adventure all together we can also unlock the Element Total Black Deck Edition!
Also the back of the cards are completely redesigned. The World is where all Elements are contained!
Element Playing Cards © are born thanks to the legendary concept of the "4 Elements" (fire, air, earth and water). They are the essence of the world and they became points of reference for the magic rituals of wizards!
According to the traditions each element give to the humans the power of the Nature and of the Goddess Diana.The 4 Elements are divided into two harmonics couples:
Fire and Air: which in the Element Deck correspond to the Red Suits.
Earth and water: which in the Element Deck correspond to the Black Suits.
It is considered the purest of the four elements and is symbolized by the HEARTS. Only a pure heart can defeat all the other elements in a poker game!
FIRE - Power in your hands
Symbolized by DIAMONDS air is considered the second upper element. It's the element of the intellect, is the kingdom of thought and control spells and rituals involving travel, education and freedom.
AIR - Become the Lord of the world
SPADES represent this element. Water is the element of purification, the subconscious mind, love and emotions, and his magic was considered by every culture and ancient civilization the primary element for the existence.
WATER - Moves the oceans
The earth is for the traditional physics the essential womb without whom nothing can be produced or brought back to life. The earth is in fact the only true home of man. Earth is symbolized by CLUBS.
UNCUT SHEET - available like Rewards and add-on!
The UNCUT SHEET of the Element Blue Deck is available from the beginning of the campaign both as a rewards or as add-on and will be shipped unframed.
Shipped in hardened cardboard tube for extra protection from damage!
SIZE: 510mm x 750mm, 20" x 29.5" (54 cards + one back)
JOKER - New Design!
JOKER - Detail
BACK - Detail
How add extra items to your reward: ADD-ON!

If want to add something to your reward, just edit your pledge and add the amount of the extra items you want indicated in the table below.
This add-on are available only for Element Blue Deck and also the UNCUT SHEET add-on came from the Element Blue Deck.
If we unlock also the Red Deck and Total Black Edition Deck we give you a lot of other possibilities for the add-on!
 Stretch goals: an adventure together!
8000€: Element Blue Deck funded!
15000€: Element Red Deck funded!
25000€: Unlocked the Original HQ Certificate with the signature of the designer IN ALL DECK!
32000€: Element Total Black Edition Deck funded!
40000€: We are ready to study new more deck design for a new campaign!
ACES - 100% New Desing!
QUEEN OF DIAMONDS - Detail
 CREDITS & NOTES:
Element Decks by Element Playing Cards is the first deck of a possible series, we hope that you like it and support us sharing this project on ALL Social Network, WE CAN DO IT!
Follow us for more detail and contacts. Here you can find more information to stay updated:
ELEMENT Playing Cards (Official Facebook Page)
Alessio Lombardi (Official Instagram profile)
ELEMENT Official Presentation Video (You Tube)
ElementCards (Official Twitter Account)
Element Playing Cards (Google+)
ELEMENT Playing Cards (linkedin)
Designed in Italy by Alessio Lombardi. All rights reserved.
A special thanks to those who talk about us and are interested to Element Playing Cards: 
ItaliaPokerClub
Gaming School 
Prestigiazione.it
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
All the deck are printed by Makeplayingcards.com (MPC).
It is a standard procedure and should proceed quite normally, MPC has a lot of years of experience and they print many (and many) decks every days!

All the designs have already been approved by MPC and to see the result we have print some deck before starting Kickstarter Campaign, they are awesome and we hope you like it!

We are located in Italy, and we can't do the fulfillment directly: we are using a professional fulfillment center. They have already shipped a lot of Kickstarter decks and have a lot of experience in this field.

Of course problems might happen. We can't control other people actions, but we will follow every step of the process to avoid problems and we will keep everyone updated.

Printed colors could be different from the ones you see on your screen.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Did you miss out on the campaign? You can still preorder at:
www.halfmoonplayingcards.com
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
EDIT: "BLACK MASS"  SOLD OUT!
A collector's dream becomes reality: The first deck ever with metallic inks printed on black stock with air-pocket embossing!
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Welcome to my new KS project!
Grotesk Macabre is the evolution of "Grotesque", which was the UC2014 annual deck. Taking this deck as a starting point, I tried to create my own vision of the Underworld. Although a joyful and positive person myself, I had always been attracted to dark themed artwork. I find fascinating how artists throughout the centuries have imagined the world of the dead and how they dealt with the greatest fear of mankind. In Grotesk Macabre I tried to combine the darkest of all themes with the heavy elegance of baroque and the pointy, flamboyant Gothic art.
Printed by EPCC
54 cards
Master finish
2 Editions: Original and Limited
Tuck cases will be printed by me in Greece, all hand numbered and signed.
Original edition tuck case printed with special inks on a matte black stock, foiled and embossed.
Animated Edition tuck case  will be printed on a gold stock, foiled and embossed .
Both editions' print run will be determined by the demand during KS campaign but the Animated Edition will be NEVER printed again. The Original Edition may be reprinted but the tuck case of any future reprints will be basic and less elaborate in production compared to the KS Original Edition
>>>>>>>> THE REWARDS WILL BE SENT FROM THE USA <<<<<<<<

UPDATE!
All KS backers will get their decks hand numbered and signed (upon request) on the tuck case! The decks sold during KS will be the only ones numbered and signed. The rest of the decks will just have the total number produced written on the tuck case.
Rendering of the tuck cases
 The picture above can hardly give an idea of the finished product as it cannot capture the shine of the gold stock combined with the foil or the surprising contrast between the matte and somewhat textured black stock and the shiny foil.
 From a black background emerges a bizarre world of  spooky creatures that dwell in the darkness...
Animated edition QoS
Queen of Diamonds
Jack of Diamonds
Ace of Diamonds - Original Edition
King of Hearts- Original Edition
Ace of Heatrs - Original Edition
Animated (Limited) edition deck will have the courts and figures framed in a marble-like intricate border. This border when you see the deck as a flip book, will be animated:
Preview of the animated border
Figure cards
The back design is mostly influenced by the Gothic architecture of Middle Ages, with a few touches of baroque.
Original edition
Limited Edition
ORIGINAL EDITION UNCUT TUCK CASE
Rendering of the tuck case uncut

Numbered and signed, a rare piece of beauty thanks to the printing technique (Special ink and foil on black stock instead of the usual black ink on white stock).

STRETCH GOALS:
$16K: Tuck case inside printing in gold metallic ink for the Original Edition and Black ink for the Animated Edition - UNLOCKED!
$17K: "BLACK MASS"  -- UNLOCKED! --
$29K: "BLACK MASS" edition is printed in Gold & Silver versions. -- UNLOCKED! ---
As with all my previous projects, the full set of courts will be released gradually during the campaign.Let's have some fun in the darkness of the Underworld!
Thank you ,
Lotrek
                               ADD-ONS
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
World War III as always is the main risk, along with a sudden mental illness. If we skip these, then we have the usual delays for which -to the extend I can control things from a few thousand miles distance- I will do everything to avoid.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Hi all,
YES!
FINALLY, the Black Mass edition is shipping this Friday (July 28th). My plan was to send all Grotesk decks together but the rest of the editions will take some more time so I couldn't justify further holding the decks that are already finished.

Hello dear all,
At last, everything is going according to the plan. The printing part of ALL editions is over. The result is just stunning and I'm absolutely happy with how they came out!
I spent 5 days in the press and we only had some minor issues that were easily solved and what finally came out of the press is a joy for the eyes! Here are some cell phone pics from the printing process:

Hi dear all,
A few days ago, after getting all the completed sheets in my hands I realized why I've been delaying so much, apart from the production issues of course. In fact I didn't want to send these decks. I'm not really pleased with the outcome.
From the beginning it didn’t go as planned. As you remember there was this silly 7 of Spades mistake, then it was the gold foil that was poorly stamped on some cards, then I discovered the same problem with some silver cards and eventually the multiple supplementary prints in various ways do not actually match the rest of the cards. This happens with both andeditions.

updates.update_userinfo: IMPORTANT update on BLACK MASS shipping -Please read!
updates.update_content:
Hi all,
This update is more like a message to all backers of both Black Mass and Black Gold decks, with a personal request to each of you.
Although more than 95% of the work needed to complete the deck is finished, I'm not yet done. I'm a full time playing card designer/producer and this means that if something goes wrong with a deck I cannot afford waiting until it is solved and the deck shipped. I have to move to the next project and at the same time work on the current. This is what happened with Grotesk Black Mass and Black Gold as . I had no other choice than to start with other projects, projects that I'm still involved to.

Hi all,
First, a HUGE apology for not having sent the decks before Christmas as I promised.
Last moment issues appeared in both Black Mass and Black Gold editions and I spent a great deal of time resolving them. In Black Mass, the people who did the assembly of the decks included cards that should had been rejected. I found it as I was checking for missing or double cards (thankfully, great job here) and I had to go through ALL decks and replace these cards with good ones. A real headache, as you can imagine...

Hello everybody,
This is probably the last update before shipment of Black Mass. A nastily delayed project is almost ready to ship. The decks are all cut and the cutting went just fine. I have some details to fix and I'm also trying to find a provider in order to have the decks wrapped in cello. I'm not sure if I'll find a satisfactory solution but I'm working on it.
Besides thanking you once again for your incredible patience, I don't have much to say for now. The completion of Black Mass will be another step in the direction of finishing with all my pending projects. 2016 had been a tough year for me but your patience and understanding was a big relieve.

Hi all, it's been a while since my last update.
While Black Mass printing is complete, I had some drawbacks, as usual... Most important of which has do do with the cutting. Don't be scared, no damage here but as I begun  I found out that the cutting die was not very sharp, causing raised edges on the front side of the cards. So it needs a good sharpening and this will take a few days to complete.
Meanwhile, the tucks are gorgeous and you can have a look at the picture below. You may be able to see those raised edges,too.
It stroke me like a thunder: Although files, proofs, printed sheets were checked again and again, this ridiculous mistake managed its way unnoticed until I begun assembling the decks!

Hi everyone!
Before I say anything, let me show you a few pics:

Hi dear all,
It's been quite some time since my last update. I'm sorry about that but as most of you know, I had to climb a mountain of problems (health ones included). Now I am back and in great form, and all problems are history!
Black Mass second print begun in mid July but it had to be interrupted due to summer closure of my printers and suppliers. Now I'm in the final stages of production and although I have been "burnt" in the past giving EDTs, I believe that I'll be able to start sending decks before the end of September. Tomorrow I'll get the printed sheets and I'll post some photos.

campaign.story:
My name is Randy Butterfield and I'm a Graphic Designer in Indianapolis, IN. I've been designing custom Playing Cards since early 2012. During that time I've always work on my Playing Card designs late at night, hence the moniker of Midnight Cards! After going with a quirky and unorthodox theme for my last project, I wanted to ground my next Deck in the essentials of a high-quality Playing Cards design. I'm proud to present the Grinders Deck!
The design of the Grinders Deck is meant to embody the workhorse mentality of a professional Grinder, but also contains elements of grandeur and opulence. (CLICK ON ANY PROJECT IMAGE FOR A HIGHER RES VERSION)
TUCK BOX:
The Grinders' Tuck Box will utilize a Black matte stock. NO inks will be printed on the Tuck. The extremely intricate design elements will be stamped in Copper AND Silver Foil. SHINY!!
The Grinders Tuck Box, Cards and Custom Brick Box (see below!) will all be printed by Legends Playing Card Co. This will be my third personal design that will be printed by Legends. They do an amazing job!! The Cards will utilize Legends' awesome Classic Finish. Classic Finish is a softer and slicker paper. It's more comparable to a vintage Bicycle Deck.
         THE JOKERS:
The Jokers for the Grinders Deck focus on a well kept Poker player ready to make his move! I drew the character in a similar hard-edge outlines with rough painted interiors, similar to the Court Cards. The Red Joker has a Queen of Hearts reveal. Which is good for any aspiring Magicians!
BACK CARD:
The Back Card shares a lot of the intricate details from the Tuck Box. Some elements in the Back Card design contain subtle references to the games of Poker and Roulette. Roulette is another game that has it's share of professional Grinders. Plus, Roulette is one of my favorites while visiting a Casino! (CLOSEUP DETAILS BELOW)
FACE CARDS:
The Face Cards are designed with the intention for maximum playability. The Courts Set is from a more classical design than most modern Courts. I have modified them and added plenty of elegant details and handpainted elements to make them unique on their own!
CUSTOM BRICK BOX:
Every TWELVE (12) Deck order will come packed inside a custom Grinders Brick Box. It will have a custom Diecut, including a top panel that folds into a display Header with the circular Logo shape Diecut above the other elements (seen below in the Render with the grey background). The Brick Box printing specs will be exactly the same as the Tuck Box - the same thick Black matte stock, Copper Foil AND Silver Foil! The Grinders Brick Box is NOT available by itself or as a separate Add-On item (it's only available with 12 Deck orders).
2" DEALER COIN:
The Grinders Coin will be produced by Coins For Anything. The 2-Sided Coin will measure 2" in diameter, and will have an Antique Copper Finish. Black Enamel will highlight the details on each side, and White Enamel will bring out the Grinders Logotype on the Coin Front. I have designed numerous Coins that CFA has produced. Above is a photo of the prototype Coin!! 
To add any extra items to your base Pledge Reward, just click on the Blue "Manage Your Pledge" Button and change the dollar amount to account for the added item(s). Please send me a PM if you have any questions or concerns.
Randy Butterfield (Midnight Cards)
https://www.facebook.com/midnightcards
LINKS TO OTHER MIDNIGHT CARD DESIGNS:
White ORNATES • Draconians • LUXX • Imperials • Bowl-A-Rama
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
FULFILLMENT - The Grinders campaign will have a duo Fullfillment strategy. All U.S. Pledge Rewards will be fulfilled from Texas, by Gamblers Warehouse. All International Pledge Rewards will be fulfilled from Hong Kong, by Legends Playing Card Co.

ARE THEY LIMITED? - Of course! I have never reprinted any of my personal Decks, and never will. I will only print the quantity of Decks and Brick Boxes needed for Pledge Rewards and off-Kickstarter orders, plus a few hundred extras for a future Midnight Cards online storefront.

WHY ONLY ONE DECK? - My last project, Bowl-A-Rama Playing Cards, turned into a pretty complex assortment of merchandise between two separate Kickstarter campaigns (three separate Decks, Wooden Nickel Sets, handmade Bowling Pins and three Uncut Sheets). So, I chose to keep this project VERY streamlined - one Deck, one Brick Box and one Coin. IF the Grinders project is a big hit, there MAY be a second Deck.

NO STRETCH GOALS? - After running many Kickstarter projects, I've noticed that listing Stretch Goals publicly on the project page sometimes leads to Backer peer pressure to Unlock items that didn't make it. More than once I've added a Stretch Goal or two to a campaign (usually a premium printing extra), even if the funding level didn't reach the Stretch Goal amount listed. It has definitely affected the bottom line in those projects! So, for this campaign I will have a Stretch Goals list of my own, but I will not share them online. They comprise of the usual - Interior Printing, Embossing, second Deck...... If / When the project gets close to a Stretch Goal, I will post a Kickstarter Update to announce that specific Stretch Goal's details.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

The New Grinders campaign is LIVE and GOING FAST!!!

Here's the sneak peek at the Pledge Tiers and Add-Ons Chart for the all NEW Grinders campaign! I'll be hitting the Launch Button at Noon EDT tomorrow (24 hours from now). Many of the Early Birds and Pledge Tiers are very limited, and will go fast. See you all tomorrow!!
thanks, Randy

TUESDAY, NOVEMBER 3rd at Noon (EDT)
The Grinders are coming soon with a whole new setup!
The original Copper Deck will now be paired with a matching custom 6-PACK BOX (in place of the custom Brick Box). The all new LIMITED White Gold Deck is the rarest Deck EVER created by Midnight Cards. Only 500 printed, and only 450 of them will be available!

Hello Everyone,
I've been contemplating a difficult decision for over a week now, and at this time I'm going forward with it. Just a few days into the Grinders' funding period, I realized some changes I would've done in the campaign's setup. The two biggest changes involve details that couldn't be done within the parameters of the current live project.
Kickstarter is great because it allows creators to adapt to the ever evolving Playing Cards market! I will be canceling funding in order to revamp the project's setup and structure. The new project will involve something I've never done before and will be exciting!!

Hey Everyone,
I wanted to give everybody the heads-up on a beautiful new set of Decks in the LUXX Series for JP Playing Cards. The LUXX Palme Decks are designed by the awesome Rick Davidson, creator of the gorgeous Origins Decks! The Palme design is inspired by the timeless Paisley pattern, and has a borderless back design that has a look that is also echoed throughout the Tuck Box and Face Cards.

updates.update_content:
Hey Everyone,
I hope everybody is having a great weekend so far!
My family and I are currently in Orlando, and today is the last day of the 52 Plus Joker Convention. It's been a great time!! We even had a surprise visit by Good Day Orlando yesterday. My Internet connection isn't great here and I haven't seen the entire footage yet, but I think it turned out well. The interviewer, David Martin, is a big Breaking Bad fan, so he talked to me about the doing the design work for the Breaking Bad Decks. I'm shy, so I did as well as I possibly could!

Thank you so much to everyone who has voted so far! It seems that there's an overwhelmingly clear preference for option B (complimentary poker chips).
So, every backer who pledges $24 or more for each campaign will receive 2 free poker chips in their reward package (1 Duel chip + 1 Grinders chip).
Congratulations everyone! and don't forget to please share the links to both campaigns to help us get funded.

campaign.story:
Bicycle Limited Edition Sistine Playing Cards will have a onetime run of 1000 decks. Never to be printed again. USPCC does not usually print small runs of Bicycle branded decks, so the pricing is a bit higher than in previous campaigns. These will be a very hard deck to get a hold of. Get a few before there all gone!
Note: USPCC has a 10% over/under policy, so there may be as little as 900 or as many of 1100 decks printed once production is finished.
Features
Printed by USPCC
Bicycle Branded
100% hand drawn artwork and custom pips
Custom numbered seal
One time print run of 1000 decks
Never to be printed again
 Air-Cushion Finish
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Bicycle Limited Edition Sistine Playing Cards have already been approved by USPCC for printing. If funded we expect to receive the the decks around January 2016 and immediately begin shipping to all our backers. We do not anticipate and challenges with this project.

How do we print and ship out rewards so quickly? We have a close relationship with USPCC. They are able to print our designs quickly and we have a state art fulfillment center to quickly ship out our backer rewards. With out you, our backers, we could not make this happen. A BIG thank you to Kickstarter and most importantly all of you!

Mike
